thread.title: Family: Swampscott mom’s accused killer ‘took everything from us’
thread.title_full: Family: Swampscott mom’s accused killer ‘took everything from us’ | Boston Herald

author: Antonio Planas
title: Family: Swampscott mom’s accused killer ‘took everything from us’
text:
A sex offender — who is charged in the murder of a Swampscott mother whose skull and bones were found on a North Shore beach this summer — briefly appeared in court today, prompting the victim’s mom after the hearing to express anguish that she knows very little of how her daughter’s mysterious death.
“I feel like I’m still back in November, on Nov. 6, because I don’t know anything,” said Michelle Mendez, whose 25-year-old daughter Jaimee Mendez went missing on Nov. 6, 2014. Her remains were found on King’s Beach in Swampscott on Jan. 28.
Prosecutors have not laid out their theory of how she was killed.
Defendant Jason Fleury, 37, formerly of Lynn, briefly appeared in Essex Superior Court today where Judge Jack Lu granted a defense motion to preserve evidence by the medical examiner. Prosecutors did not object to the motion.
Mendez’s disappearance last year sparked North Shore police to launch a broad search for her.
Fleury was arrested in August by Virginia authorities after an Essex County grand jury indicted him for Mendez’s murder. He has pleaded not guilty to Mendez’s murder.
Fleury, a Level 3 sex offender, was convicted of raping a child in 1997.
Danny Newton, 30, of Lynn, is the father of Mendez’s baby and was dating her when she disappeared.
Fleury, Newton said, “took everything from us.”
And there will never be justice, Newton said, because “my son will never see his mother again.”
